Pre-Test Questions.Question: When can you overtake on the left?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: You can overtake on the left when: the vehicle ahead is turning right, if you are turning left immediately after overtaking, or in slow moving lanes of traffic.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: At an uncontrolled junction of equal importance, to whom would you give the right of way?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Traffic on your right or traffic already in the junction.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is a box junction and what rules apply?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Area marked with criss-cross yellow lines meaning you may not enter unless your exit is clear. You may wait in the junction if you are turning right provided you would not cause an obstruction.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is a clearway?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: An area at the side of the road where you may not stop or park during the times listed except for buses or taxis.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: When should you dip your headlights?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Oncoming traffic, behind another vehicle, in a well lit area, in dense fog or falling snow, and at the beginning and end of the lighting hour.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is a safe distance to travel behind another vehicle?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Always allow a gap of 2 seconds between the vehicles and double in wet weather.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is the minimum depth of thread on a tyre?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: 1.6 millimeters (1 millimeter for motor cycles and vintage cars).

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is the legal parking distance from the kerb?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Within 45cms.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is the legal parking distance from a junction?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: 5 metres.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What regulations apply to the use of a horn?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Do not use the horn in a built up area between 11.30PM and 07:00AM except in an emergency.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does an amber traffic light mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Stop if you can safely do so.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a red traffic light mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Stop.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a green traffic light mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Proceed with caution if it is safe to do so.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a flashing amber traffic light mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Proceed if the crossing is clear, but pedestrians still have the right of way.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does flashing red lights mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Stop, train approaching.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a continuous white line/lines in the middle of the road mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: You must not cross the line/lines or park opposite.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a continuous white line with a broken white line alongside mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Overtaking allowed on the broken side only.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a continuous yellow line at the side of the road mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: No parking during certain hours.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What do double continuous yellow lines mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: No parking at any time.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a broken yellow line mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: It marks the edge of the road or hard shoulder.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What do white zigzag lines mean and where would you see them?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: No stopping, no parking or overtaking on approach to a pedestrian crossing.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: How would you know you were entering a one-way street from the wrong end?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: No entry sign, no entry on road and continuous white line with a broken white line behind.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: Where would you stop if a stop sign did not have a white line?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: At the sign.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: Give examples of where you should not park.
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Brow of a hill, hump back bridge, near a bend, near a junction, obstructing a road sign, at a bus stop, at an entrance, opposite another vehicle on a narrow road, at a taxi rank, opposite a single or double continuous white line, in a bus lane, or on a footpath.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What should you do if you had an accident?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Stop.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does the island in the centre of a pedestrian crossing mean?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Each side of the island is a separate crossing.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: When can you drive in the hard shoulder?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Temporarily to let someone overtake providing the hard shoulder is clear.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is the maximum distance allowed between the drawing vehicle and trailer or vehicle being towed?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: A distance of no more than 4.5 meters.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: When towing if the distance between the vehicles is more than 1.5 metres what procedure must be followed?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: A warning device such as a white flag or at least 30 square centimetre must be placed to draw attention to the tow bar or rope.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: You may not park within what distance of a pedestrian crossing?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: 15 metres before or 5 metres after.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What procedure must you adopt if crossing a dual carriageway with a narrow central median?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: If the median is too narrow for your vehicle you must wait until you can complete the crossing.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is the main difference between a motor way and a dual carriageway?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: You can only turn off to the left, there is no right turning traffic, speed limits, no stopping, no traffic lights, and no roundabouts.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What would you look out for on country roads?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Pedestrians, animals, muddy surfaces, concealed entrances, slow moving farm machinery, etc.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is the maximum speed limit on a motorway?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: 120kph.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: When being overtaken what must you not do?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Increase your speed.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: How would you recognise a zebra crossing at night?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: By the yellow flashing beacons.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What position would you take up to make a right turn out of a one-way street?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: The extreme right lane.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: Where would you never do a U-turn?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: In a one-way street, where there is a continuous white line, or where a sign directs you not to do so.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is a contra flow bus lane?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: A bus lane running in the opposite direction to the traffic which may never be used by other vehicles.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is a with flow bus lane?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: A bus lane running in the same direction as traffic and may not be used at certain times of day.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is meant by tailgating?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Driving too close to the vehicle in front; i.e. not keeping the stopping distance.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What are the main factors that can affect your driving?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Alcohol, drugs (prescription and non prescription), tiredness and fatigue, road rage, and other forms of aggression.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: When may you use the outside lane of a dual carriageway?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: When overtaking or when intending to turn right a short distance ahead.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What does a red triangle indicate?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Dangerous hazard i.e. accident or vehicle breakdown.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is coasting and why is it potentially dangerous?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Coasting is when the vehicle is not being driven by the engine, i.e. the clutch pedal is held down or the gear level is in neutral. It is dangerous because it reduces the driver’s control of the vehicle, particularly breaking and steering. Also, if anything unexpected happened it could be difficult to engage gear.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: How far away from a pedestrian crossing must you be if you are crossing the road without using the crossing?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Not within the white zigzag lines or in their absence 15 metres form the crossing.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: Seat belts – who is responsible?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: The driver is responsible for themselves and any passengers under the age of 17; all passengers over the age of 16 are responsible for themselves.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: Where should you not overtake? Give examples.
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: At a bend, the brow of a hill, a humpback bridge, at a continuous white line, at a pedestrian crossing, or anywhere your view is obstructed.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What must you check before starting the engine?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Check that the handbrake is on and the vehicle is in neutral.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What colour traffic light follows amber?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: Red.

Pre-Test Questions.Question: What is the national speed limit of Ireland?
Pre-Test Questions.Answer: 100kph.
